IN.IC: je oblika za sedanjik, preteklik in pretekli deležnik.

sense.def:
To cut something
pomeni v neko stvar potisniti nož ali podobno orodje, da odstranimo del te stvari, jo zaznamujemo ali poškodujemo.

seg.quote: She cut the cake and gave me a piece.
His wife killed herself by cutting her wrists.
...thinly cut rye bread.

gramGrp.pos:
REFL VB
or
VB
with
OBJ

sense.def:
To cut oneself
pomeni po nesreči se poškodovati z ostrim predmetom in zato krvaveti.

seg.quote: Robert cut his knee quite badly.

sense.def:
To cut across an area
ali
to cut through an area
pomeni zlahka iti čez neko območje.

seg.quote: I cut across country for the next hundred miles.
The big canoe was cutting through the water.

sense.def:
To cut an amount
pomeni zmanjšati neko količino.

seg.quote: She cut her costs by half.

sense.def:
Kadar je del zapisa
cut
, ni natisnjen ali predvajan.

seg.quote: Her publishers insisted on cutting several stories out of her memoirs.
He agreed to make a few minor changes and cuts in the play.

sense.def:
To cut someone's hair
pomeni nekomu skrajšati lase s škarjami.

seg.quote: Tell him to get his hair cut.

sense.def:
Obleke, ki so
well cut
, so dobro oblikovane in izdelane.

seg.quote: He wears beautifully cut suits.

sense.def:
To make a cut in something
pomeni v neko stvar potisniti nož ali podobno orodje, da tisto zaznamujemo ali poškodujemo.

seg.quote: He made a deep cut in the wood.

sense.def:
A cut
je tudi poškodba, ki nastane, kadar se urežemo z ostrim predmetom in krvavimo.

seg.quote: I had some cuts and bruises but I'm OK.

sense.def:
A cut of meat
je velik kos mesa.

A cut in an amount
je zmanjšanje neke količine.

seg.quote: ...large cuts in government spending.

sense.def:
Če je nekaj
a cut above other things of the same kind
, je boljše kot druge stvari enake vrste.

seg.quote: The meals they serve are a cut above most pub food.

sense.def:
To cut back
ali
to cut back on some money
pomeni, da zmanjšamo količino denarja, ki ga trošimo.

seg.quote: Congress cut back the funds.

sense.def:
To cut down on an activity
pomeni manj pogosto se ukvarjati z neko dejavnostjo.

seg.quote: She had cut down on smoking.

sense.def:
To cut a tree down
pomeni zasekati skozi deblo, da drevo pade na tla.

To cut in on someone
pomeni nekoga prekiniti, ko govori.

seg.quote: Mrs Travers began a reply, but Mrs Patel cut in again.

sense.def:
To cut something off
pomeni nekaj odstraniti tako, da tisto odrežemo.

seg.quote: Lexington cut off a small piece of meat.
...egg sandwiches with the crusts cut off.

sense.def:
To cut off a place or a person
pomeni ločiti kraj ali osebo od tistega, s čimer sta navadno povezana.

seg.quote: The town was cut off.
We have cut ourselves off from the old ways of thinking.
She is completely cut off from friends.

sense.def:
Če je dobava nečesa
cut off
, tistega ne dobavljajo več.

seg.quote: Gas supplies had now been cut off.
They are threatening to cut off funds.

sense.def:
To cut someone off
pomeni prekiniti telefonsko zvezo, kadar se nekdo pogovarja po telefonu.

To cut out part of something
pomeni odstraniti del nečesa z orodjem, ki ima oster rob.

seg.quote: Badly decayed timber should be cut out and replaced.

sense.def:
To cut out
pomeni, da nehamo nekaj delati ali govoriti nekaj.

seg.quote: Cut out waste.
He's cut out the drinking altogether.

sense.def:
Če neki predmet
cuts out the light
, svetlobi prepreči dostop do nekega prostora.

Kadar motor
cuts out
, nenadoma preneha delovati.

seg.quote: It keeps cutting out when I stop.

sense.def:
To cut something up
pomeni nekaj narezati na več kosov.
